briefTitle: Goal Achievement After Utilizing an Anti-PCSK9 Antibody in Statin Intolerant Subjects-4
officialTitle: A Double-blind, Randomized, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Evolocumab, Compared With Ezetimibe, in Hypercholesterolemic Japanese Subjects Unable to Tolerate an Effective Dose of a HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor Due to Muscle Related Side Effects
summary: The primary objective of the study was to evaluate the effect of 12 weeks of subcutaneous (SC) evolocumab compared with ezetimibe, on percent change from baseline in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) in hypercholesterolemic adults unable to tolerate an effective dose of a statin.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) at the Mean of Weeks 10 and 12
